version.label: BP 1.3.2010
version.description: Original forms used during pilot and for most of first year

version.label: BP 6.11.2010 - SE 25.2.2010
version.description: Added crown density measurements measured at five points and soil table added.

item.label: Accessible
item.description: Topographic and road or river network make it possible to reach the site

item.label: Inaccessible - slope
item.description: Very steep hill making the field work dangerous

item.label: Inaccessible - owner refusal
item.description: Owner does not allow one to enter the site either by fencing or by not giving permission

item.label: Inaccessible - restricted area
item.description: E.g. military areas, border areas, land mines areas

item.label: Inaccessible - water body
item.description: Water body does not allow to sample or reach the site

item.label: Inaccessible - other reason
item.description: Specify in remarks

item.label: Production forest
item.description: Land designated for production and extraction of products (wood, fibre, bio-energy and/or non-wood forest products). Includes concessions, exploitation licenses, community forests etc.

item.label: Protection forest
item.description: Protected forest lands. Including also nature reserves, soil conservation, water and watershed protection, protection against erosion and landslides.

item.label: Wildlife reserve
item.description: National parks, game reserves, game controlled areas etc

item.label: Agriculture
item.description: Incl. agro-forestry

item.label: Built-up areas
item.description: Urban or rural, or mixed. Including roads, buildings, ower lines, etc.

item.label: Water body or swamp
item.description: Seasonal, Permanent or Swamp

item.label: Other land
item.description: To be specified in Remarks

item.label: Central government land
item.description: Owned by central government, or by government-owned institutions or corporations

item.label: Local government land
item.description: Owned by local government (district)

item.label: Village land
item.description: Owned by a collective, a group of co-owners, or a community who hold exclusive rights and share duties

item.label: Private land
item.description: Owned by private enterprises, industries, individuals or families, private co-operatives, corporations, religious and educational institutions, pension or investment funds, NGOs, nature conservation societies or other private institutions

item.label: General land
item.description: Public land that does not belong to any of the above categories

item.label: Not known
item.description: No information available on the land ownership

item.label: Other vegetation
item.description: To be specified in Remarks

item.label: No damage
item.description: Naturally open area, or normal tree vegetation where might be some individual trees damaged by insects, fungus or other reason but otherwise forest is in good condition

item.label: Fire
item.description: Disturbance caused by fire

item.label: Insects, fungus or diseases
item.description: Disturbance caused by insect pests or by fungus. Disturbance caused by diseases attributable to pathogens, such as bacteria, fungi, phytoplasma or virus.

item.label: Other biotic agents
item.description: Disturbance caused by biotic agents other than insects or diseases, such as wildlife browsing, grazing, physical damage by animals, etc. Specify in Remarks.

item.label: Wind or other abiotic factor
item.description: Disturbances caused by abiotic factors, such as storm, drought, air pollution, etc. Specify in Remarks.

item.label: Human activities
item.description: Cuttings, firewood collecting, debarking, other human-made damages

item.label: None
item.description: No damages

item.label: Slight
item.description: Evidences of damages are visible, but not causing long-term damages. Only few trees are affected

item.label: Serious
item.description: Damages are clearly visible, probably causing long-term damages or loss of growth. Several trees are affected

item.label: Very serious
item.description: Damage is finally causing wide mortality of trees, or hinders them growing. Mortality is likely to remain high for a long time

item.label: No soil
item.description: E.g. built-up area, water

item.label: Sand
item.description: Soil having mostly sand particles. A wet sample does not stain hands.

item.label: Loamy sand
item.description: Soil in which sand particles are predominant but also containing silt. Slightly sticky, but no ribbons can be formed.

item.label: Sandy loam + Sandy clay loam + Sandy clay
item.description: Makes a sound, when rubbed between the fingers close to the ear. Allows to be formed into a stick of cigarette size.

item.label: Loam
item.description: Soil having mostly silt and with some clay. Only a relatively thick ribbon can be formed which will break soon after formation from its own weight. Rubbing between fingers makes a very light sound only.

item.label: Clay loam
item.description: Soil having higher percentage of clay loam particles but also having some sand and silt. Forms a thin ribbon which will readily break from its own weight when about 2-4 cm long. No sound when rubbed between fingers.

item.label: Clay
item.description: Soil contains mostly clay particles. Highly plastic and slippery when handled. Allows to be formed into a thin string.

item.label: Silt + Silt loam + Silty clay loam + Silty clay
item.description: Substrate particles smaller than sand and larger than clay. Silt is easily transported in water or other liquids and is fine enough to be carried long distances by air as 'dust'

item.label: Other
item.description: To be specified in Remarks

item.label: Granular
item.description: If the topsoil is granular, the water enters easily and the seed germination is possible.

item.label: Blocky
item.description: Blocky soil looks like irregularly-shaped blocks. Movement of the water is moderate.

item.label: Prismatic
item.description: Movement of the water in the soil is predominantly vertical and therefore the supply of water to the plant roots is usually poor.

item.label: Platy
item.description: When present in the topsoil, a platy structure blocks the entrance of water; seed germination is difficult due to poor aeration.

item.label: Massive
item.description: Soil particles occur in solid masses and do not break aprt easily under light pressure. This structure blocks the entrance of water and seed germination is difficult due to poor aeration associated with very finely textured soils, like clay.

item.label: Single grain
item.description: Soil particles exist as individual soil grains that do not stick together and generally remain loosely-packed. This structure is found in sandy soils.

item.label: No erosion
item.description: No evidence of soil erosion

item.label: Light erosion
item.description: Slight erosion where only surface erosion has taken place.

item.label: Moderate erosion
item.description: Where mild gullies and rills are formed on the top surface of the soil.

item.label: Heavy erosion
item.description: Areas which have deep guillies, ravines, land slips etc.

item.label: No grazing
item.description: There is no evidence of grazing

item.label: Occasional
item.description: Only choice plants and areas show use. There is no use of poor forage plants

item.label: Frequent
item.description: Most range shows use. 1/3 – 2/3 of primary forage plants showing use

item.label: Extensive
item.description: Lands can be severely hedged. There is evidence of life-stock trailing to forage. More than 2/3 of primary forage plants showing use

item.label: Bare land
item.description: No water catchment value

item.label: Low
item.description: The area has vegetation but it is not a particular source of water

item.label: Medium
item.description: Seasonal rivers providing water to lower land areas

item.label: High
item.description: Area contains lakes, ponds, rivers, or it is a forest land which collects/feeds water to lower land areas

item.label: No impact
item.description: No cutting or other impact, or the cutting has happened more than 5 years ago

item.label: Clear felling
item.description: Removal of all trees has been carried out. The generation of forest is done by planting, seeding or coppicing.

item.label: Silvicultural treatment
item.description: e.g. pruning, planting, climber cutting, weeding, boundary clearing, fire line construction

item.label: Medicinal activities
item.description: Collecting of medicinal plants (e.g. leaves, bark, roots) used in traditional medicine and/or for pharmaceutical companies

item.label: Land-use change (from forest, woodland or bushland)
item.description: Specify previous Land use class in Remarks

item.label: Afforestation
item.description: Establishment of forest through planting and/or deliberate seeding on land that, until then, was not classified as forest. Implies a transformation of land use from non-forest to forest. Specify previous Land use type in Remarks

item.label: Mining, Sand collection
item.description: Mining and land extraction activities

item.label: Other
item.description: Specify in Remarks

item.label: Fruits, nuts, seeds, roots, berries, etc
item.description: Vegetable foodstuffs and beverages provided by fruits, nuts, seeds, roots, etc.

item.label: Mushrooms
item.description: Foodstuffs provided by mushrooms.

item.label: Fodder
item.description: Animal and bee fodder provided by leaves, fruits, etc

item.label: Plant medicines
item.description: Medicinal plants (e.g. leaves, bark, roots) used in traditional medicine and/or for pharmaceutical companies.

item.label: Dying / tanning
item.description: Plant material (bark and leaves) providing tannins and other plant parts (especially leaves and fruits) used as colorants.

item.label: Other plant products
item.description: Specify in Remarks

item.label: Wildlife
item.description: Provides habitat for wildlife

item.label: Windbreaks
item.description: Acts as a windbreaker

item.label: Shade
item.description: Provides shade

item.label: Aesthetic
item.description: Provides landscape beauty

item.label: Recreation and tourism potential
item.description: Including ecotourism, hunting or fishing as leisure activity. Unique feature.

item.label: Cultural heritage potential
item.description: Including religious / spiritual potential

item.label: Other
item.description: Specify in Remarks

item.label: Thinning
item.description: In the case of plantation

item.label: Silvicultural treatment
item.description: e.g. pruning, planting, climber cutting, weeding, boundary clearing, fire line construction

item.label: Change status
item.description: E.g. productive to protective or vice versa. Explain in Remarks.

item.label: Big mammals
item.description: Lion, elephant, rhino, etc

item.label: Rare biotope
item.description: e.g. spring, oasis
Sparse shrub canopy cover
Very open shrub canopy cover
Open shrub canopy cover
Closed shrub canopy cover

item.label: Healthy tree (Default)
item.description: A tree is healthy when it does not show symptoms of disease or other that have any substantial effect on the tree’s growth and vitality.

item.label: Diseased tree
item.description: A tree is affected when it shows symptoms of disease or attack by insects that affect the tree’s growth and vitality.

item.label: Affected by Ficus sp.
item.description: Ficus which may eventually destroy its host.

item.label: Other damage agent
item.description: Specify in Remarks

item.label: Dead tree
item.description: Dead standing tree. Laying dead tree data is recorded on Dead Wood Form.

item.label: Fully or partially rotten wood material
Field interview
item.description: Field interview completed

item.label: Questionnaire checked
item.description: Checking questionnaire

item.label: Data entry
item.description: Entering data into database

item.label: Data cleaned
item.description: Checking and approving data entry

item.label: Food grown on land owned and cultivated by household
Food grown on land cultivated but not owned by household (e.g. land rented)
Food from forest (mushroom, fruits, bushmeat, etc.)
Food given as gift or food aid
Harvest more wild foods not found in forest
Assistance from NGO, community/religious organization or similar
Loan from money lender, credit associations, bank, etc.

list.name: forest_disturbance_response
list.label: Forest disturbance response
list.description: Response to major disturbances in local forests decreasing forest product availability

item.label: By harvesting more of other forest products
By harvesting from a different forest
Forest: Humid Montane
item.description: Catchment forest, > 800 m asl

item.label: Forest: Lowland
item.description: Groundwater forests, some coastal forests, < 800 m asl.

item.label: Forest: Mangrove
item.description: Area of forest and other wooded land with mangrove vegetation.

item.label: Forest: Plantation
item.description: Note: Detect Planting year in Plot data

item.label: Woodland: Closed (>40%)
item.description: Beekeeping, Hunting, Recreation, Grazing, Conservation, Timber production

item.label: Woodland: Scattered cropland (Unspecified density)
item.description: Shifting cultivation

item.label: Bushland: Thicket
item.description: below 5 m

item.label: Bushland: Dense
item.description: Grazing

item.label: Bushland: Scattered cultivation
item.description: Shifting cultivation

item.label: Bushland: Open
item.description: Hunting, Recreation, Grazing

item.label: Grassland: Wooded
item.description: Hunting, Recreation, Grazing

item.label: Grassland: Scattered cropland
item.description: Cultivation

item.label: Grassland: Open
item.description: Hunting, Recreation, Grazing

item.label: Cultivated land: Agro-forestry system
item.description: Chagga home gardens with timber and fruit trees shading coffee, banana, beans, yams

item.label: Cultivated land: Wooded crops
item.description: Monocultures of tea, cashewnuts, cloves, coffee

item.label: Cultivated land: Herbaceous crops
item.description: Maize, wheat, rice, bananas, cotton, sisal

item.label: Cultivated land: Mixed tree cropping
item.description: Fruit (coconut, mango, orange), cashew, grain vegetables

item.label: Cultivated land: Grain crops
item.description: Various types of grass crops e.g., maize, wheat, millet, rice, sorghum.

item.label: Open land: Salt crusts
item.description: Mining for salt

item.label: Open land: Rock outcrops
item.description: Recreation

item.label: Water: Inland water
item.description: Lake, river, seasonal water body

item.label: Other areas
item.description: Urban and rural build-up areas, air fields, infrastructure (powerlines, railways, mining sites)

item.label: Serious illness or disability in family
Between 2 and 5 km from the HH
Not Applicable
item.description: Timber, beams, poles for construction, etc

item.label: Decreasing
item.description: When quantity harvested has decreased

item.label: No Change
item.description: When the quantity harvested has not changed

item.label: Increasing
item.description: When quantity harvested has increased

list.name: harvest_rights
list.label: Harvest rights
list.description: User rights to harvest the product

item.label: No
item.description: No local rules exist that regulate use of product

item.label: Not applicable
item.description: No payment was received from anybody

item.label: Central Government
item.description: Central government office and its agencies

item.label: NGOs
item.description: Non-governmental Organization

item.label: Individual
item.description: An individual has paid for the environmental service, i.e. tourists paying a visitor's fee

item.label: Local community group that made the rules
Accomodating with follow up action, to solve problem
The solving of the conflict is still ongoing
Knowledge of activities in the area
Share is much lower than it should be
Share is somewhat lower than it should be
Share is somewhat higher than it should be
Share is much higher than it should be

number.name: distance_to_segment
number.label: Distance to Segment (empty in the foxpro)

text.name: species_code
text.label: Species Code (foxpro:just label, noentry in foxpro)
